title: Current density - I-total when J is k r-squared

content.description: A long conducting cylinder has radius <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, as shown in the figure, and carries a current to the left. The current density varies with distance <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the cylinder’s central axis according to the equation <math alttext="J equals, k times lowercase r squared" overflow="scroll"><mi>J</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="lowercase r is less than or equal to uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>R</mi></math> and <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"> <mi>k</mi> </math> is a positive constant.
content.question: What is the total current in the cylinder?

choices.label: <math alttext="one third times k, times uppercase R cubed" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one fourth times k, times uppercase R to the fourth power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times k, times uppercase R to the fourth power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction pi over 5, end fraction, times k, times uppercase R to the fifth power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>5</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times k, times uppercase R to the fourth power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
